original_text:
DISCHARGE DIAGNOSES :
1. Acute asthmatic bronchitis , rule out underlying chronic obstructive pulmonary disease .
2. History of coronary artery disease , status post myocardial infarction x 3 , status post angioplasty .
3. History of ischemic cardiomyopathy with left ventricular ejection fraction of 20% to 25% .
4. History of benign prostatic hypertrophy .
5. History of cardiac arrhythmia .
6. History of pacemaker .
DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS :
1. Nitro - Dur patch 0.2 mg per hour .
2. __________ extended release tablets 300 mg with five tablets daily .
3. Zocor 40 mg daily .
4. Cozaar 50 mg daily .
5. Plavix 75 mg daily .
6. Potassium supplement 20 mEq daily .
7. Lasix 40 mg daily .
8. Coreg 3.125 mg b.i.d.
9. Aspirin 81 mg a day .
10. Proscar 5 mg daily .
11. Nexium 40 mg a day .
ALLERGIES :
The patient is allergic to ,
1. Penicillin .
2. Procainamide .
3. Iodine based dyes .
HOSPITAL COURSE :
This is a **AGE[in 60s]- year - old white male with the abovementioned medical condition , who was admitted with cough , shortness of breath , and a chest congestion .
The patient had symptoms of 1 week , was treated as an outpatient with IV Levaquin , did not resolve , came to the emergency room , was evaluated .
The patient with bilateral expiratory wheeze .
Chest x-ray by ER physician showed pneumonia , was started on Avelox .
The patient was also started on breathing treatment , felt better .
At this point , he is doing much better .
No chest pain .
No shortness of breath .
Chest x-ray is unremarkable .
Pulmonary consultation was obtained .
The patient was seen by Dr. **NAME[XXX] .
The patient was started on albuterol inhaler .
Avelox was continued .
The patient is also being discharged on Avelox , tapering doses of prednisone , and albuterol inhaler .
The patient was advised to follow up with Dr. **NAME[XXX] in 2 weeks ' time in his office .
He will need pulmonary function tests to rule out underlying COPD .
At the time of discharge , the patient is asymptomatic .
______________________________
**NAME[YYY ZZZ] , M.D.
HS Job # 576848 / 41125 / 12667
# **ID-NUM
D :
**DATE[Jun 08 2007] 15:53
T :
**DATE[Jun 11 2007] 05:11
